content:
WORKSHOP on DOCTRINES and FIBRATIONS, May 29 - June 1, 2023

dedicated to W. (Bill) Lawvere

posting on behalf of Ma. Emilia Maietti

==============================================

CALL FOR PARTICIPATION

===============================================
WORKSHOP on DOCTRINES and FIBRATIONS
May 29 - June 1, 2023
Department of Mathematics, University of Padova, Padova, Italy
Conference website https://events.math.unipd.it/WDF2023/

==============================================

The workshop aims to bring together researchers to discuss their work on
Lawvere doctrines, Grothendieck fibrations as studied and developed by Benabou, and their applications
to logic and other mathematical fields.

The workshop is dedicated to the memory of William Lawvere (1937-2023).

Attendance is open to everyone interested, in particular to young
researchers.

The workshop will be held in person.

=====================================================

Tutorial Speakers:

Giuseppe Rosolini (Università di Genova, Italy)
Thomas Streicher (Technische Universität Darmstadt, Germany)

========================================================

Invited Speakers:

Steve Awodey (Carnegie Mellon University, USA)
Valeria de Paiva (Topos Institute, Berkeley, USA)
Jacopo Emmenegger (Università di Genova, Italy)
Jonas Frey (Carnegie Mellon University, USA)
Alexandre Miquel (Universidad de la República, Uruguay)
Fabio Pasquali (Università di Genova, Italy)
Davide Trotta (Università di Pisa, Italy)
Benno van der Berg (Universiteit van Amsterdam, Netherlands)
Jaap van Oosten (Universiteit Utrecht, Netherlands)

========================================================

CONTRIBUTED TALKS

Few slots for contributed talks are available: please send a pdf file with title and abstract include in a pdf format of at most 2 pages to

wfd@math.unipd.it

Deadline for contributions: 6th May

Acceptance: 12th May.

========================================================
REGISTRATION:
To attend the workshop and receive all updated information about it,
please send a message to

orgwdf@math.unipd.it
